intro: Pedicularis szetschuanica subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, with a distinctive two-lipped structure. Its leaves are broad and opposite, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas.
